page.title: 11Master Johns Farmhouse
page.content: Master Johns is typical of many of the farmhouses in the area which are now just ordinary homes. Often they are bought by professional people who spend a lot of time renovating the properties. When we arrived we saw ducks, ducklings, geese, hens, dogs and cats all wandering freely around the house and barns, which are in about one acre of land. The house was originally built in the 14th century, but little of that remains. Most of the house was rebuilt in the 18th century with some Victorian additions. There are workshops at the back of the house, where wooden furniture is made, such as chairs, desks, cabinets and tables in mahogany, pine and walnut. This sort of special work is the only kind of industry in our area apart from farming.
